alert.note: Alert for Lower Vermilion; Upper Vermilion (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 10:49AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Iberia, southeastern Lafayette and northeastern Vermilion Parishes through 1115 AM CDT... At 1049 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Henry, or near Abbeville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Avery Island, Broussard, Youngsville, Erath, Delcambre, Jefferson Island and Henry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
